DzMap Class Reference
[Object and Geometry Classes]

Base class for all property value maps. Meshes can have any number of maps of various types. More...

#include <dzmap.h>

virtual void writeData (DzOutFile *file) const

Detailed Description

Base class for all property value maps. Meshes can have any number of maps of various types.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzMap::MapType

The types of possible maps - each describes the type of values and dimension of the map.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzMap::DzMap ( MapType  type = FLOAT_MAP  ) 

Constructor. Creates a new map of the given type.

Parameters:
type The type of map to create

Member Function Documentation

void DzMap::appendFloatValue ( float  val  )  [slot]

Append a new value to the end of a float map This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The new value to append to the map.
void DzMap::appendIntValue ( int  val  )  [slot]

Append a new value to the end of a integer map This function is only valid for maps of INT_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The new value to append to the map.
void DzMap::appendPnt2Value ( const DzPnt2  val  ) 

Append a new value to the end of a 2D float map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by appendPnt2Vec(). This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The new value to append to the map.
void DzMap::appendPnt2Values ( int  num,
const DzPnt2 *  vals 
)

Append a list of value to the end of a 2D float map. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
num The number of values to append
vals The new values to append to the map.
void DzMap::appendPnt2Vec ( const DzVec3 &  val  )  [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 2 maps. It is considerably slower than appendPnt2Value(), so plug-in developers should avoid using this function. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The value to append to the map. The z value of the vector is ignored.
See also:
appendPnt2Value()
void DzMap::appendPnt3Value ( const DzPnt3  val  ) 

Append a new value to the end of a 3D float map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by appendPnt3Vec(). This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT3_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The new value to append to the map.
void DzMap::appendPnt3Vec ( const DzVec3 &  val  )  [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 3 maps. It is considerably slower than appendPnt3Value(), so plug-in developers should avoid using this function. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT3_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The value to append to the map.
See also:
appendPnt3Value()
void DzMap::appendShortValue ( short  val  )  [slot]

Append a new value to the end of a short value map This function is only valid for maps of SHORT_MAP type.

Parameters:
val The new value to append to the map.
void DzMap::clearAllData (  )  [slot]

Clears all map values. After this call, the number of values in the map will be zero.

virtual QString DzMap::getExtension (  )  const [inline, virtual]
Returns:
The three-letter extension to associate with storable items of each derived type.

Implements DzStorable.

virtual QString DzMap::getFiletype (  )  const [inline, virtual]
Returns:
The filetype string that is saved as part of the file information

Implements DzStorable.

float * DzMap::getFloatArrayPtr (  )  const
Returns:
A pointer to the array data for a float map. Calling this for a map of a different type will return a NULL pointer.
double DzMap::getFloatValue ( int  idx  )  const [slot]

This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a float map
int * DzMap::getIntArrayPtr (  )  const
Returns:
A pointer to the array data for an integer map. Calling this for a map of a different type will return a NULL pointer.
int DzMap::getIntValue ( int  idx  )  const [slot]

This function is only valid for maps of INT_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a integer map

Returns:
The map's label.

Returns:
Number of dimensions for this map.
int DzMap::getNumValues (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
Number of values currently in the map table.
DzGeometry * DzMap::getOrderingGeometry (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The geometry that this map has been reordered to match, or NULL if none.
DzPnt2 * DzMap::getPnt2ArrayPtr (  )  const
Returns:
A pointer to the array data for a 2D float map. Calling this for a map of a different type will return a NULL pointer.
const float * DzMap::getPnt2Value ( int  idx  )  const

This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a 2D float map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by getPnt2Vec().
DzVec3 DzMap::getPnt2Vec ( int  idx  )  const [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 2 maps. It is considerably slower than getPnt2Value(), so plug-in developers so avoid using this function. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a 2D float map. The z value is set to zero.
See also:
getPnt2Value()
DzPnt3 * DzMap::getPnt3ArrayPtr (  )  const
Returns:
A pointer to the array data for a 3D float map. Calling this for a map of a different type will return a NULL pointer.
const float * DzMap::getPnt3Value ( int  idx  )  const

This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT3_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a 3D float map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by getPnt3Vec().
DzVec3 DzMap::getPnt3Vec ( int  idx  )  const [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 3 maps. It is considerably slower than getPnt3Value(), so plug-in developers so avoid using this function. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT3_MAP type.

Returns:
The value of this map for the given index, or the default value if the index is out of range - for a D float map.
See also:
getPnt3Value()

DzMap::mapModified (  )  [signal]

Emitted whenever values are added, removed or modified on the map

Handles backwards compatibility when reading from the native file format

Parameters:
file The file being read
void DzMap::preSize ( int  num  )  [slot]

Pre-allocates size of the data array.

Parameters:
num The new number of values to pre-allocate for the map.
void DzMap::reorderEntries ( DzGeometry *  geom,
const int *  indices 
)

Shuffles the values in this map according to the indices given. It is assumed that each index value appears exactly once in the array. The array must have exactly the same number of entries as there are values in this map.

Parameters:
geom A pointer to the gometry that this map is adjusted to.
indices An array of new indices for the exisiting values.
void DzMap::setDefaultFloatValue ( float  x  )  [slot]

Sets the default value for a float map. This is the value returned if the map is empty or a map data value is requested that is outside the index range of this map. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT_MAP type.

Parameters:
x The new default value for the map.
void DzMap::setDefaultIntValue ( int  x  )  [slot]

Sets the default value for an integer map. Thi is the value returned if the map is empty or a map data value is requested that is outside the index range of this map. This function is only valid for maps of INT_MAP type.

Parameters:
x The new default value for the map.
void DzMap::setDefaultPnt2Value ( const DzPnt2  x  ) 

Sets the default value for a 2D float map. This is the value returned if the map is empty or a map data value is requested that is outside the index range of this map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by setDefaultPnt2Vec(). This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
x The new default value for the map.
void DzMap::setDefaultPnt2Vec ( const DzVec3 &  defaultVal  )  [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 2 maps. It is considerably slower than setDefaultPnt2Value(), so plug-in developers should avoid using this function.

Parameters:
defaultVal The default value of this map. The z value of the vector is ignored.
See also:
setDefaultPnt2Value()
void DzMap::setDefaultPnt3Value ( const DzPnt3  x  ) 

Sets the default value for a 3D float map. This is the value returned if the map is empty or a map data value is requested that is outside the index range of this map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by setDefaultPnt3Vec(). This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT3_MAP type.

Parameters:
x The new default value for the map.
void DzMap::setDefaultPnt3Vec ( const DzVec3 &  defaultVal  )  [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 3 maps. It is considerably slower than setDefaultPnt3Value(), so plug-in developers should avoid using this function.

Parameters:
defaultVal The default value of this map.
See also:
setDefaultPnt3Value()
void DzMap::setDefaultShortValue ( short  x  )  [slot]

Sets the default value for a short value map. Thi is the value returned if the map is empty or a map data value is requested that is outside the index range of this map. This function is only valid for maps of SHORT_MAP type.

Parameters:
x The new default value for the map.
void DzMap::setFloatValue ( int  idx,
float  val 
) [slot]

Set one of the currently existing data values on a float map This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT_MAP type.

Parameters:
idx The index of the value to set.
val The new value.
void DzMap::setIntValue ( int  idx,
int  val 
) [slot]

Set one of the currently existing data values on a integer map This function is only valid for maps of INT_MAP type.

Parameters:
idx The index of the entry to set
val The value of this map for the given index.
void DzMap::setLabel ( const QString &  label  )  [slot]

Sets the user-readable label for the map.

Parameters:
label The new label for the map.
void DzMap::setMapType ( MapType  mapType,
bool  keepData = false 
) [slot]

Changes the type of this map

Parameters:
mapType The new type for the map
keepData If true, the existing data will be converted to the new type as much as possible. If false, the existing data is lost, and the number of values in the map will be zero.
void DzMap::setNumValues ( int  num  )  [slot]

Sets the size of the data array. Does not initialize newly allocated values.

Parameters:
num The new number of values contained in the map.
void DzMap::setPnt2Value ( int  idx,
const DzPnt2  val 
)

Set one of the currently existing data values on a 2D float map. DAZ Script access to this functionality is provided by setPnt2Vec(). This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
idx The index of the value to set.
val The new value.
void DzMap::setPnt2Vec ( int  idx,
const DzVec3 &  val 
) [slot]

This function is provided for DAZ Script access to float 2 maps. It is considerably slower than setPnt2Value(), so plug-in developers should avoid using this function. This function is only valid for maps of FLOAT2_MAP type.

Parameters:
idx The index of the entry to set
val The value of this map for the given index. The z value of the vector is ignored.
See also:
setPnt2Value()
